questionText: Which block of the periodic table contains elements with the \(d\) orbitals progressively filled?
explanation: The d-block contains elements of the groups 3-12 in which the d orbitals are progressively filled.
chapter: The d- and f- Block Elements
topic: Position in the Periodic Table

questionText: Which of the following elements is NOT considered a transition metal?
explanation: Zinc, cadmium, and mercury have full \(d^{10}\) configuration in their ground state as well as in their common oxidation states and hence are not regarded as transition metals.
chapter: The d- and f- Block Elements
topic: Position in the Periodic Table

questionText: How many series of transition metals are there in the periodic table?
explanation: There are mainly four series of the transition metals: 3d series (Sc to Zn), 4d series (Y to Cd), 5d series (La and Hf to Hg), and 6d series (Rf to Cn).
chapter: The d- and f- Block Elements
topic: Position in the Periodic Table

questionText: The inner transition metals consist of which series?
explanation: The inner transition metals consist of the 4f series (Ce to Lu) and 5f series (Th to Lr), known as lanthanoids and actinoids, respectively.
chapter: The d- and f- Block Elements
topic: Position in the Periodic Table

questionText: What is the common characteristic of transition metals according to IUPAC?

options.text: They have incomplete d subshell either in neutral atom or in their ions
They have full d subshell in their ground state

explanation: According to IUPAC, transition metals are defined as metals which have incomplete \(d\) subshell either in neutral atom or in their ions.
chapter: The d- and f- Block Elements
topic: Position in the Periodic Table

questionText: Which of the following elements are often referred to as transition metals and inner transition metals?
explanation: The names 'transition metals' and 'inner transition metals' are often used to refer to the elements of \(d\)- and \(f\)-blocks respectively.
chapter: The d- and f- Block Elements
topic: Position in the Periodic Table

questionText: Which series of the transition metals is also known as the 3d series?
explanation: The 3d series of transition metals includes elements from Scandium (Sc) to Zinc (Zn).
chapter: The d- and f- Block Elements
topic: Position in the Periodic Table

questionText: What is the configuration of the outer orbitals for the transition elements?
explanation: In general, the electronic configuration of outer orbitals of transition elements is \((n-1)d^{1-10} ns^{1-2}\).
chapter: The d- and f- Block Elements
topic: Position in the Periodic Table

questionText: Which element has an electronic configuration of 3d^{5} 4s^{1} instead of 3d^{4} 4s^{2}?
explanation: Chromium has the configuration 3d^{5} 4s^{1} instead of 3d^{4} 4s^{2} due to the stability provided by the half-filled d subshell.

topic: Position in the Periodic Table

questionText: What is the ground state electronic configuration of the outer orbitals of Scandium (Sc)?
explanation: The ground state electronic configuration of Scandium (Sc) is 3d^{1} 4s^{2}.

topic: Position in the Periodic Table

questionText: Which element in the 3d series has the ground state electronic configuration of 3d^{10} 4s^{1}?

questionText: Which of the following elements belongs to the 4d series of transition metals?
